intro: Lapeirousia divaricata, commonly known as the Orange River daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers with a prominent central disk. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces a basal rosette of narrow, linear leaves and has a short, stout stem. Lapeirousia divaricata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to arid environments.
